Headline: Wheel invented
Text: The oldest wheels we know of are found in this period in Mesopotamia.

Headline: Akkadian Empire
Text: The Akkadian Empire controls mesopotamia. Meaning Iraq, Kuwait, northeast Syria and southeast Turkey and the Levant.

Headline: Ur III
Text: The empire of the Third Dynasty of Ur is the preeminent power in mesopotemia. Ruling over the lands in Kuwait and south iraq.

Headline: Gilgamesh poems written
Text: The first seperate Poems of the Epic of Gilgamesh are attributed to this timeframe.

Headline: Legendary Xia Dynasty
Text: Least known of all dynasties, very little known.

Headline: Babylonia founded
Text: Babylonia is founded by Sumuabum. It speaks akkadian. It's base of power is in the center of iraq, Babylon.

Headline: oldest single Gilgamesh
Text: The earliest surviving references to a single combined Epic saga of Gilgamesh are compiled in this time.

Headline: Hammurabi expands babylon
Text: Hammurabi rules the babylonian state and greatly extends its borders to mesopamia. He creates his code of law.

Headline: Jie of Xia overthrown
Text: Traditionally viewed as an extremely cruel king, having created a lake of alcohol, only to make 3000 men drink it and drown.

Headline: Shang Dynasty
Text: Most of historical period known from oracle bones.

Headline: Sack of Babylon
Text: Dated by middle chronology this is the date of the sack of Babylon by the Hittites under king Mursili I.

Headline: Middle Assyrian Empire
Text: Ruling from a base of power in Assur in north Iraq, near east Turkey. Ashur-uballit I oversees the rise of Assyria from 1365 to 1330 bc, overthrowing the Mittani.

Headline: Standard Epic of Gilgamesh
Text: The standard version of the Epic of Gilgamesh as known in modern times is written in this timeframe. It is edited by Sîn-lēqi-unninni.

Headline: Late Bronze Age collapse
Text: Many of the cities and civilizations from greece, turkey to egypt are destroyed and abandoned.

Headline: Spring and Autumn period
Text: Period of the Eastern Zhou where dukes and marquesses have more and more obtained de facto regional power.

Headline: Eastern Zhou period
Text: DUring this period in ancient China the emporer is only a figurehead and power rests in several mostly independant states.

Headline: Iliad composed
Text: Dated around -760 to -710, the Iliad is composed in this time period.

Headline: Ashurbanipal
Text: Lifetime of Ashurbanipal, last strong king of the Neo-Assyrian empire. He accrued many books and scrolls in his library at Nineveh.

Headline: Battle of Hyrba
Text: Cyrus the great defeats the meads, starting the unification persians.

Headline: THe spanish captain Monteverde seizes upon the earthquake to take Venezuela and Caracas. They quickly beat forces under Miranda, a little role played by Bolivar. Bolivar arrests Miranda and hands him over to the spanish for his alledged betrayel of the republic. Bolivard manages to flee to Curacao.
Cambyses II
Text: Bardia usurps and dies quickly at the end

Headline: Darius the Great
Text: Rules over at least 44% of the world's population

Headline: Battle of Salamis
Text: Athenians decisively defeat the navy of the Persian Empire through a pincer movement.

Headline: Warring States period
Text: Emporer truely merely a figurehead amongst power struggles of competing states.

Headline: Philip II of Macedon
Text: The father of Alexander the Great. Establishes a well trained military and develops tactics for Macedonia, conquers greece.

Headline: Conquest of Thessaly
Text: Philip invades Thessaly, got beaten and then came back the next year with many more troops. 20,000 infantry and 3,000 cavalry. He wins the battle of Crocus Field. Does not advance further into central greece because the Athenians hold Thermopolea

Headline: Crossbows in China
Text: Crossbows have been invented for a while and are now seeing confirmed military use in China.

Headline: Battle of Chaeronea
Text: Denial of Theban fighting leads to victory of Philip II, uniting almost all of Greece.

Headline: Battle of Granicus River
Text: Alexander, near Troy, defeats the forces of the local satrap in Asia Minor.

Headline: Battle of Issus
Text: Greek cavalry beats and routes Darius, captures his family.

Headline: Siege of Tyre
Text: Alexander builds a land bridge to the island, or now peninsula of Tyre. "Killed 10,000 men and enslaved 30,000"

Headline: Battle of Gaugamela
Text: Alexander the Great invades the Achaemenid Empire. He beats Darius 3 in his own territory while outnumered by superior tactics and Darius's cowardice. Around 47k greeks vs 90k persians.

Headline: Bessus kills Darius
Text: A satrap betrays the king of kings and tries to hand his head to Alexander the Great.

Headline: Appian Way constructed
Text: Construction started on the Appian way

Headline: Pyrrhic War
Text: Roman legionaries beat greek hoplites

Headline: Qin Dynasty
Text: First dynasty to gain control over the whole of China. Lasted a very short time but set up for the Han.

Headline: Lex Claudia
Text: Introduced through a tribute of the plebs, this law prevents Senators and their sons from owning ships larger than 300 amphorae. This prevents senators from making a large amount of money through trade.

Headline: Han dynasty
Text: A golden age of economic prosperity for China

Headline: Empress Lü Zhi executes Concubine Qi
Text: The new power after her husband Emporer Gaozu of Han, founder of the Han, died. She quickly goes to work and executes the family of and the Concubine Qi. This causes her son to become sick, or so is rumored, and she holds de facto power over the Han dynasty china for 15 years.

Headline: Sulla captures Jugurtha credit to Marius
Text: Marius takes credit

Headline: Marius gives up power and retires east
Records of the Grand Historian
Text: Records of the Grand Historian are finished by Sima Qian, comparable to a chinese herodotus. These texts describe a 2500 year period from the start of the Yellow Emporer to the Emporer Wu of Han in the contemporary time.

Headline: Marcus Livius Drusus assassinated
Text: Tribune of the plebs killed for laws enacted.

Headline: Social War
Text: Rome vs italian cities, Sulla commands mostly

Headline: Sulla marches on Rome
Text: Marius flees to Africa

Headline: Cinna(Consul) stoned to death by own troops
Battle of the Colline Gate
Text: Sulla's 2nd march on rome aided by Crassus and Pompey

Headline: Sulla dies
Text: "No friend ever served me, and no enemy ever wronged me, whom I have not repaid in full"

Headline: Third Servile War
Text: Spartacus and all that

Headline: Cicero prosecutes Gaius Verres
Text: Gaius Verres had plundered sicily whilst governer there. Cicero launched his legal carreer by prosecuting him for his crimes. Verres quickly fled rome, but Cicero did publish the speeches he would have used against him as "In Verrem" (against Verres)

Headline: Consulship Caesar
Text: Caesar is elected consul after a particularly bribe heavy election. Even Cato is said to have resorted to bribary.

Headline: Battle of Bibracte
Text: Caesar and 6 roman legions fight the Helvetii tribe, winning and stopping a large migration through roman territory.

Headline: Gaelic Campaign
Text: Caesar subjegates France

Headline: Julia, wife of pompey, dies
Text: Julia, daughter of Caesar and wife of Pompey dies. Starts the breakdown between Caesar and Pompey.

Headline: Battle of Alesia
Text: Caesar is besieges Alesia, but is then encircled by a large relief army of Gauls.

Headline: Caesar crosses the Rubicon
Text: Caesar crosses the small stream of the Rubicon, which symbolically marks the region of Italy.

Headline: Pharsalus battle
Text: Caesar beats Pompey

Headline: Library of alexandria destroyed
Text: One of the possible dates for the destruction of the library of alexandria.

Headline: Battle of Dyrrhachium
Text: Near modern Albania the army of Gnaeus Pompeius Magnus defeats Caesar, but he does not press his victory fearing he had not really beaten Caesar.

Headline: Proscriptions Second Triumvirate
Text: After taking power Mark Antony and Augustus kill off a lot of people to get rid of their enemies and seize a lot of wealth. Cicero is amongst those killed.

Headline: Battle of Actium
Text: Octavian/Agrippa beats Anthony

Headline: Aeneid written
Text: The Aeneid is written by Virgil. Sponsored by Augustus, this book explains how the romans descend from the greeks by Aeneas who flees the sack of Troy.

Headline: First constitutional settlement
Text: Augustus makes a show of handing power back over to the Senate and then graciously accepting his power back.

Headline: Second constitutional settlement
Text: Octavian (Augustus) given at large pro-consular authorithy in all provinces outside of Italy. He no longer had to serve as Consul, letting other ambitious men hold the title so that they would not hate him for taking up the spot. Agrippa heir apparent for the moment.

Headline: Marcellus dies
Text: Marcellus, nephew of Augustus and married to Augustus daughter, dies.

Headline: Legionary standards returned
Text: Augustus/Agrippa negotiate the return of the Legionary standards lost to Parthia by Crassus.

Headline: Rome conquers Alps
Text: Amongst a string of wars fought by Augustus, rome pacifies the Alps.

Headline: Agrippa dies
Text: Tiberius and Drusus are now heirs apparent for Augustus succession.Tiberius forced to divorce Vipsania and marry Julia the Elder, Augustus's daughter. This made Tiberius very unhappy.

Headline: Tiberius self-imposed exile
Text: Tiberius chooses to retire to Rhodes, being unhappy in roman politics.

Headline: Lucius and Gaius dead
Text: Both sons of Agrippa die in tragic accidents, Tiberius must now be heir. For this he is forced to adopt his nephew Germanicus.

Headline: Battle of the Teutoburg Forest
Text: The romans get massacred in an ambush, forever after do they fear expansion into germanic territories.

Headline: Augustus dies
Text: Augustus dies in his old age, power is smoothly handed over to Tiberius.

Headline: Germanicus forrays into germany
Text: Germanicus, adopted son of Tiberius, puts down troop uprisings in Germania and holds punitive expeditions into Germany. Though he does not manage to capture Arminius.

Headline: Germanicus promoted East, dies
Text: Germanicus is promoted away from glory by Tiberius and sent to the east, here is dies under suspicious circumstances in Egypt.

Headline: Livia dies
Text: Livia Drusilla, mother of Tiberius, wife of Augustus, dies. Sejenus now has free reign over Rome in the absence of Tiberius, who has moved to Capri.

Headline: Sejenus executed
Text: Sejenus plotted against Tiberius to become emporer. Tiberius made him read aloud his letter to the senate ordering his own execution, he is executed by the senate. Tiberius returns to rome, more treason trails follow as well as proscriptions resume. Caligula made heir apparent (the man proving you should never put your trust in 'it can't get any worse' )

Headline: Tiberius dies
Text: Tiberius is smothered with a pilo by the new praetorian prefect after a bout of illness, supposedly to finish the job. Tiberius leaves empire to Caligula and Tiberius Gemellus. Caligula has Tiberius Gemellus killed and the will voided.

Headline: Caligula sickness
Text: Caligula suffers from a sickness, he recovers but after this he becomes a more diabolical emporer, instituting prescriptions to gather money. He also promises to make his horse consul as it 'has more intelligence than the senate'

Headline: Caligula mock campaign
Text: Caligula hosts some mock excursions into germany and gathers seashells in britain, hosts himself a title and adds titles.

Headline: Caligula assassinated
Text: Caligula is assassinated by Cassius Loginus and Cassius Chaerea. The senate attempts to restore the republic but the military empores Claudius, who they think they can control.

Headline: Messalina executed
Text: Messalina, the wife of Claudius is executed for treason. Reportedly she married her lover Gaius Silius in a large public ceremony at Ostia. After this coup failed by Gaius Silius, she was executed. Claudius marries Agrippina the younger, his niece.

Headline: Nero adopted
Text: Claudius adopts Nero

Headline: Claudius murdered
Text: Claudius is murdered, supposedly by poison. The chief suspect is Agrippina the younger, who's son Nero is now emporer. Agrippina had to murder Claudius before his original son Britannicus could gain power. Apparently Claudius had threathened to divorce her once Britannicus would come of age soon after. Brittanicus is soon murdered.

Headline: Great Fire of Rome
Text: A great fire burns through rome, starting on the Aventine hill and ravaging a large part of the city. Nero is soon blamed by the public, reputedly burning down the city to make space for his emporer complex. Nero decides to blame the Christians and persecutes them (leading to Nero standing for '666', or the number of the beast).

Headline: Great Jewish Revolt
Text: THe jews are unhappy about the tax farming system. The temple in Jerusalem has recently been finished and now many young men are unemployed in the region. November sees a legion from Syria being wiped out, Vespasian is ordered by Nero to put down the revolt.

Headline: Vindex put down
Text: Gaius Julius Vindex, governer of Gallia Lugdunesis in modern France, rises up in rebellion against Nero's tax policies. He calls upon Galba, governer of Hispania Tarraconesis, to rise up in revolt and declare himself emporer. Galba waits for awhile to see developments. Then Vindex is put down by Rufus of Germania Superior, whos troops try to hail him emporer but he declines and lives.

Headline: Nero suicide
Text: Nero had Galba declared an enemy of the state, but Galba kept gaining followers so Nero attempts to flee. Finally decides to kill himself. Galba is hailed as emporer by senate and Nero is made the public enemy posthumously. Galba does not pay a large donatif to the Praetorians, as had been promised by non-associated people for him in Rome.

Headline: Otho kills Galba
Text: Otho, one of Galba's earliest supporters, decides to kill Galba after Galba passes him up as an heir. Otho goes into a fury and kills Galba. Otho is broke after putting all of his eggs on the 'getting heirship' basket.

Headline: First battle of Bedriacum
Text: Vitellius has risen up along the Rhine, declaring Otho an illegitimate usurper. The troops from the Rhine are hardened by the Germanic Wars. Otho's suddenly raised forces are defeated, and Otho kills himself to prevent further slaughter of romans.

Headline: Second battle of Bedriacum
Text: Verspasians forces from the eastern provinces have come and picked up more forces along the way. The manage to beat Vitellius's forces. Vetellius tried to give up but his supporters killed Vespasians brother, Vespasian takes rome. After the taking of Rome, there is general chaos.

Headline: Fall of Jerusalem
Text: The largest last bastion of the great jewish revolt falls as Jerusalem is taken by Titus, son of Vespasian.

Headline: Titus
Text: Died of a fever

Headline: Mount Vesuvius Eruption
Text: Pompeii is covered over, a large amount of people die.

Headline: Fire in Rome
Text: A large number of important buildings are destroyed, Titus rushes to aid the city of Rome.

Headline: Colosseum completed
Text: The colosseum had started being built in 70 ad under Vespasian, being completed ten years later under Titus.

Headline: Dacian War
Text: The Dacians invade Moesia over the Danube, one legion is annihalated. Other problems in the empire, trouble amongst the Rhine and Pannonia, caused the Romans to sue for peace. In exchange for freeing prisoners the Dacian king Decebalus obtains roman engineers to build forts that are later used against the romans.

Headline: Saturninus rebels
Text: The general and governer of Germania Superior, Lucius Antonius Saturninus and his two legions rebel against Domitian. Saturninus had made a deal with the Chati to help him, but due to a surprise thaw they cannot come, Saturninus is soon crushed. Nerva is made consul together with Domitian the next year, possibly for uncovering a plot or possibly unrelated.

Headline: Domitian assassinated
Text: Domitian is assassinated by court officials. Killed in his hime by a close friend, in legend he had been foretold to die at noon and only relaxed when noon had passed. A servant told him the wrong time and this leads to his death. The senate makes Nerva emporer afterwards as a stopgag measure, as they cannot agree with themselves who to make emporer.

Headline: Praetorians siege Imperial Palace
Text: The Praetorian guard, protectors of the emporer, lay siege to the Imperial Palace and take Nerva as a hostage. To calm them Nerva promises to put the assassins of Domitian to death.

Headline: Trajan heir
Text: Trajan is made heir to Nerva. This gives Nerva strong support amongst the military, as Trajan is a popular general. Trajan is given the same power as Nerva, but Trajan does not travel to rome quickly, waiting until Nerva's death and prospecting the provinces meanwhile.

Headline: Nerva stroke
Text: Nerva dies a natural death as an emporer, Trajan is now officialy emporer, without any real opposition.

Headline: First Dacian campaign
Text: Trajan has amassed forces for awhile and makes a first invasion on Dacia, a province with rich goldmines. He defeats a dacian army, this was a close battle and Trajan delays for the rest of the year to regroup his army.

Headline: Peace with Dacia
Text: After the second battle of Tapae, Trajan and Decebalus make peace the following spring. Decebalus seems to agree to terms but soon afterwards starts rearming and harbouring roman refugees.

Headline: Second Dacian War
Text: Amassing some 14 legions along the Danube border, some 150-175,000. Fighting against around 200,000. The romans decisively win, and conquer up to 500,000 slaves, 165,500 kg of gold and 331,000 kg of silver.

Headline: Rome wars Parthia
Text: Parthia puts an unacceptable king on the throne of Armenia. Trajan uses this to make a war against an internally divided Parthia. He quickly manages to defeat them, and conquers down to the Persian gulf, through modern day Iraq and Kuwait. This also gave them much better access to the silk road. A string of victories follow, but Trajan catches a heat stroke. Trajan dies, and possibly due the involvement of his wife, Hadrian is made emporer.

Headline: Second Jewish war
Text: The second major campaign against the Jews sees a huge number of Roman civilians, 460,000, die in Cyranaica, Cyprus and Egypt.  Large jewish communities are annihalated or uprooted and moved away. Some of the areas have to be resettled due to so very few people remaining behind.

Headline: Hadrian pulls back
Text: Hadrian gives up lands in Mesopotamia and upper Dacia, finding them to be indefensable. This is a great affront to the Roman senate and army but the begrudingly accept.

Headline: Trajan executes 4 senators
Text: Trajan finds four prominent senators to be conspiring against him and he has them executed, they are hunted down and killed. As Hadrian is not yet in Rome he can feign innocence.

Headline: Hadrian Wall started
Text: The construction of the Hadrian wall in England is started. This was ment to control their movement and funnel them through checkpoints whenever trade was conducted.

Headline: Hadrian travels empire
Text: Hadrian travels around the empire and has a great many buildings constructed and infrastructure improved. Apart from one brief stay in 128, he does not return to Rome.

Headline: Antinous drowns
Text: Antinous, the favourite lover of Hadrian, drowns in the Nile river. The circumstances are unknown. Hadrian is greatly saddened by this death, he founds a city on the place of his death, Antinopolis, and proclaims him a god without approval of the senate. Antinous becomes one of the most wellknown faces as many statues are constructed in his honour.

Headline: Hadrian creates Panhellenion
Text: A great fan of all things Greek, on his visit through the province of Greece Hadrian creates a parliament of the greeks to try to foster cooperation. This fails after his death.

Headline: Third Jewish War
Text: The Bar Kokhba revolt, a large organised revolt by the jews around Judea.  120,000 romans from 7 legions are brought in to put down the revolt. Around 580,000 jews are killed, with many more dying of famine and disease. Massive roman casualties.

Headline: Han-Xiongu war
Text: A major war with their northern rivals, the Xiongu confederacy, establishes the han as a dominant power and clears the silk road for Han use.

Headline: Lucius Caesar made heir
Text: Lucius Caesar is made the heir, but he is in poor health. Marcus Aurelius is married to the daughter so that he will be the heir of Lucius. To give him more time to grow up.

Headline: Antoninus made heir
Text: Lucius dies at the start of 138, and Antoninus is made heir. Marcus Aurelius is to be adopted by Antoninus and be his heir.

Headline: Antoninus dies
Text: Antoninus dies of an illness in 161, Marcus Aurelius is made emporer and he insists that his adopted brother Lucius Verus is made co-emporer.

Headline: Roma Parthia war
Text: Lucius is sent to the eastern provinces after Parthians invade Armenia and wipe out a responding roman legion. Lucius makes his way over very slowly and delegates most of the commanding to capable generals. The romans counter attack during 163 and slowly win untill 166 when a peace is signed. Avidius Cassius makes a name for himself during this war.

Headline: Tiber floods
Text: Much of Rome is flooded in a great flooding of the Tiber river. This is given special personal attention by both emporers.

Headline: Buddhism preached in China
Text: Lokaksema starts preaching Buddhism in China.

Headline: Antonine Plague
Text: The antonine plague, braught back from the Parthian war, ravages the Roman Empire. May have also effected China. A mortality rate of about 25% throughout the roman empire.

Headline: Marcomannic Wars
Text: Marcus spends many years fighting chiefly the Marcomanni and Quadi and the Sarmatian lazyges. Along all of the Danube frontier there is fighting, hampered by the Antonine plague depleting the legions and farmlands. In the end he is succesful and manages to enforce favourable roman terms.

Headline: Ballomar besieges Aquileia
Text: King of the Marcomani, Ballomar assembles a force of 20,000 and invade Rome. They make good time over the Roman infrastructure and manage to reach and shortly but failedly besiege Aquileia. This marks the first time in 266 years that a hostile army enters Italy.

Headline: Avidius Cassius uprising
Text: After a mistaken report that Marcus Aurelius had died, Avidius Cassius declares himself emporer. Possibly urged on by Faustina, the wife of Marcus, to protect the son Commodus. Avidius had already cast the die, went on with the dead but was put down, and he was murdered by a centurion. After this leaders are not allowed to lead the provinces they are born in, and troops are stationed far away from their homes to prevent such loyalties from being created.

Headline: Commodus peaces Germans
Text: Commodus quickly makes peace with the Germans, having enough of living in damp and cold troop encampments. The german tribes eagerly want this after having fought wars for so long. Commodus hosts many games on his return and quickly turns to treason trails and the selling of offices to pay for them.

Headline: Conspiracy Lucilla anti Commodus
Text: A conspiracy of high-ranking advisors, one of the chiefs being Lucilla the older sister of Commodus, attempts to kill Commodus. The assassin tries to kill him on the street, allegedly shouting something about payback from the senate. Lucilla wants to kill commodus because he now has a wife and she is no longer the preeminent woman of the roman empire. Commodus's favourite chamberlain Saoterus is killed by the conspirers.

Headline: Perennis accused treason
Text: Perennis, the favourite of Commodus from the death of Saoterus, is finally implicated by Cleander. Generally thought to be a competent administrator, Perennis was corrupt though and accused of being so by many others. However Commodus believed Perennis over the others, after soldiers come marching from Britain to the capital Commodus gives in and has Perennis killed. Cleander becomes de-facto ruler.

Headline: Cleander's fall
Text: Cleander is in power untill 190 and many consulships and positions are sold off. During a grain shortage, the blame is laid on Cleander. Mobs are roused against Cleander. At the horse races, where the emporer still came, children were bought to protest against Cleander, Praetorian guard sent in to stop them, but Pertinax sends in Vigiles Urbani to stop the Praetorians and continue the protest. Commodus agrees to behead Cleander.

Headline: 25 consuls appointed
Text: A revolving door of consuls is appointed as men bid money to add consul to their list of accomplishments. Rome has had increasing amounts of consuls, with a division between Suffect consulships and during the year and Consul Ordinarius who started the year and had the year named after them.

Headline: Commodus assassinated
Text: For two years Commodus has let his lust for adoration run rampant on Rome. He re-consecrates Rome as 'Colonia Lucia Annia Commodiana', and renames all the months after his names, renames legions and fleet after himself. Laetus prefect conspires against Commodus and after a struggle with his wrestling partner he is killed. Made a public enemy posthumously.

Headline: Pertinax reigns
Text: Pertinax is disciplined, but he is not liked because of austere measures to save the empire from financial ruin of Commodus. He takes back some of the benefits going to the legions, and the troops turn against him.

Headline: Didius Julianus emporer
Text: Julianus buys the emporership from the Praetorian guard who kill Pertinax, Septimius Severus comes in quickly afterwards and has him killed.

Headline: Severus vs Niger
Text: The armies of Severus and Pescennius Niger fight near Byzantium, Severus wins. Niger was very slow to muster his troops in the area. A second battle, the battle of Cyzicus, follows in december on northwest Anatolia.

Headline: Praetorian guard disbanded
Text: Severus disbands the Praetorian guard that had killed Pertinax and auctioned off the emporership. The members are forbidden to ever come near rome again. He increased the size of the Praetorian guard and made it consist of the best soldiers of the empire. This saps the border legions of their best men.

Headline: Battle of Issus
Text: Forces under Severus, commanded by Anullinus, manage to narrowly beat Niger. Niger tries to flee but fails and is beheaded.

Headline: Battle of Lugdunum
Text: Clodius Albinus finally figures he has been betrayed after Severus names a different heir that is not Albinus. Ablinus musters a large forces and starts marching towards rome. The two forces meet near Lugdunum or modern Lyon. Ancient sources give 150,000 legionaries against 150,000, with modern around 75,000 against 75,000. The battle raged two days with many shifts back and forth, was one of the largest encounters between romans ever.

Headline: Plautianus executed
Text: The powerful Praetorian Prefect has a lot of influence over Severus after 197. Until a denouncement by the emporer's dying brother, Plautianus de-facto rules in the empire.

Headline: British military campaign
Text: Severus campaigns to quell and conquer scotish peoples, he takes his sons Caracala and Getta with him to try and teach them manners.

Headline: Caracalla murders Geta
Text: Caracalla has his brother Geta murdered at a reconciliation meeting arranged by their mother, whilst their mother watches. Afterwards Caracalla orders a damnatio memoriae (ordered by a forced senate), and in some of the largest purges yet around 20,000 people are killed, those being Geta's friends, advisors or military staff under his employ.

Headline: Constitutio Antoniniana
Text: Caracalla gives every free man in the Roman Empire citizenship. This tries to increase state revenue, by creating more tax paying citizens but this still gives some measure of standing to those citizens.

Headline: Caracalla plunders Alexandria
Text: Alexandria, a roman city, is plundered by the roman emporer Caracalla. They had put on a play that mocked Caracalla's murder of his brother ('in self-defence'). His troops loot Alexandria for several days.

Headline: Rome-Persian War
Text: Adrashir I, having established himself as ruler of the new sasanian empire, seeks a war of expansion against Rome. Rome under Severus Alexander has a lackluster defense, 2 columsn are sent to flank the sasanid empire but Alexander in the middle column provides no pressure and the campaign fails. A unofficial white truce results and Alexander celebrates a triumph in rome.

Headline: Maximinius Thrax kills Alexander
Text: Leading an uprising, Maximinus Thrax kills Alexander. He has popular support from the armies because Alexander is seen as a coward due to his negotiations and stalling. Using this Thrax becomes the first 'barbarian' emporer of Rome, scorning the senators and instead using the army where he is much loved. He would double the pay for his soldiers, which required a large tax increase.

Headline: Gordians rise up
Text: The procurator of Africa, Gordian 1 and his son Gordian 2 rise up in africa against Thrax. The Senate supports them but they don't have an army in Africa and are killed. Leaving 1 Gordian in rome. Gordian could do this because he was famous for the lavish games he threw in his past.

Headline: Pupienus and Balbinus declare revolt
Text: Having declared support of the Gordians, 2 senators in Rome are elected augustus, with Gordian III seleted as Caesar to appease the people.

Headline: Siege of Aquileia, death of Thrax
Text: The soldiers of Thrax siege Aquileia which has shut its gates. During this siege the soldiers become discontent and kill Thrax, afterwards have no plan.

Headline: Gordian III marries daughter prefect
Text: Timesitheus is made praetorian prefect and Gordian III marries his daughter, making him the most powerful man in the empire.

Headline: Battle of Resaena
Text: After Shapur I invades the Roman empire and takes several cities the Romans organise a large response. Timesitheus and Gordian III beat Shapur at this battle.

Headline: Timesitheus dies
Text: Philip 'the arab' is made Praetorian prefect, possibly killed Timesitheus.

Headline: Battle of Misiche
Text: The Romans and Sasanians fight again, Shapur decisively beats the Romans on Sasanid ground near modern Fallujah. Somewhere in this Gordian dies, possibly in battle but romans say by his officers. Philip the arab becomes emporer.

Headline: Ludi Saeculares
Text: Rome celebrates it's 1000th anniversary, the celebrations are led by Philip the arab. Over 1000 gladiators die.

Headline: Battle of Verona
Text: Decius, having been sent to Moesia to quell unrest and rebelion, takes over the rebellion and kills Philip the arab.

Headline: Battle of Abritus
Text: In Moesia Inferior, modernday Razgrad, Bulgaria, the roman empire under Decius fights against the gothic leader Cniva. Decius' army is caught by surprise by soldiers concealed in a swamp. Decius dies and is the first roman emporer to be killed by a foreign army. Trebonianus Gallus made emporer by army, Hostillian made emporer by senate, they come a peaceful arrangement of co-emporership.

Headline: Hostilian dies
Text: Hostilian dies of the Cyrpian plague, first emporer to die of natural causes in 40 years.

Headline: Battle of Barbalissos
Text: Shapur I annihilates a force of 60,000 romans near Aleppo.

Headline: Aemilianus emporer
Text: Aemilianius is aclaimed by Moesian troops as emporer after he beats the invading Goths. Takes his troops to rome and kills Gallus.

Headline: Valerian emporer
Text: Velerian proclaimed emporer and Moesian troops kill Aemilianus.

Headline: Valerian heads east, Galienus caesar
Text: Valerian heads east to deal with the invasion of Shapur I, makes his son Galienus caesar.

Headline: Alamanni invade
Text: Gallienus has to deal with an invasion of the Alamanni. They get as far Rome but are repelled.

Headline: Battle of Mediolanum
Text: Gallienus beats the retreating Alemanni, delivering total defeat. This invasion however scares the Romans of italy and reveals the weakness of the border defense.

Headline: Battle of Edessa
Text: Shapur I defeats roman forces under Valerian and captures Valerian. Defeating all the roman forces, Valerian becomes the first captured emporer. one of the worst disasters in roman military history.

Headline: Postumus rules north west
Text: Postumus raises the flag of rebellion and starts his rule over Britain, Spain, parts of Germania and Gaul.

Headline: Odaenathus rules east
Text: Odaenathus repels Shapur I in a series of brilliant battles. In theory he paid service to the emporer and was subservient but was de facto and independant ruler of the Levant, Mesopotamia and eastern Anatolia.

Headline: Odaenathus killed, Zenobia rules
Text: Zenobia rules in her sons Vaballathus' stead, as he is still young. Odaenathus is killed by assassins.

Headline: Battle of Naissus
Text: Claudius Gothicus routes a massive goth invasion.

Headline: Gallienus killed
Text: Gallienus is murdered by assassins, Claudius is the new emporer.

Headline: Aurelian kills Quintillus
Text: Quintillus rose up after the death of Claudius.

Headline: Claudius dies
Text: Claudius dies of the Cyrpian plague, Quintillus (his brother) tries to grab power.

Headline: Battle of Placentia
Text: Aurelian defeated in an ambush by the Juthungi.

Headline: Battle of Fano
Text: Aurelian defeats a force of Juthungi who were moving to defenseless rome.

Headline: Dacia abandoned
Text: Rome pulls back from Dacia, marking the shrinkage of the Roman Empire.

Headline: Aurelian reconquers Palmyrene Empire
Text: After a brief campaign through eastern rebel cities, Aurelian gives pardons to the first city he sieges. The rest quickly surrender. Palmyra is captured and Zenobia and her son are dragged out in chains.

Headline: Library of alexandria burned
Text: Aurelian's conquest of Alexandria burned down a part of the city housing the library of alexandria, possibly destroying a large section of the library.

Headline: Palmyra revolts, is leveled
Text: Palmyra is destroyed and its citizens are dragged off to live elsewhere after it revolts again.

Headline: Gallic Empire reconquered
Text: Aurelian reconquers the Gallic provinces after their leader Tetricus defects.

Headline: Aurelian murdered
Text: Aurelian is murdered by his generals after they fear he will kill them first after a forged document is published that shows they are to be executed.

Headline: Jin dynasty
Text: (Started in 265 when most of Jin conquest was completed)

Headline: Battle of Margus
Text: Diocletian decisive victor and emporer of rome

Headline: Maximian junior augustus
Text: Constantius 1/Galerius Caesars

Headline: Galerius and Constantius made Caesars
Text: 2 junion caesars are appointed next to Maximian and Diocletian, making for 4 emporers, 2 junior and 2 senior.

Headline: Constantius reclaims britain
Text: The father of constantine reclaims Britain for the roman empire.

Headline: Battle of Satala
Text: Galerius beats sassanid empire

Headline: Constantius 1 Co-Augustus
Text: Untill he dies of natural causus

Headline: Diocletian retires
Text: The only emporer to ever voluntarily abdicate, Diocletian retires after a long bout with disease to go farm cabages.

Headline: Maxentius rules Italy
Text: Defeated by constantine

Headline: Shapur II reigns Sasanids
Text: An eternal enemy of the romans, he waged many wars against the roman empire from constantine to Theodosius

Headline: Milvian Bridge Battle
Text: Constantine beats Maxentius

Headline: Ambrose elected bishop of Milan
Text: By popular pronouncement, without any churchly experience or even being baptised.

Headline: Theodosius last emporer of whole roman empire
Liu Song dynasty
Text: Southern dynasty, north divided into number of states

Headline: Vandal Kingdom recognized
Text: North Africa conquered

Headline: Vandals Sack Rome
Text: In response to denial marry daughter of Valentinian 3

Headline: Leo 1 emporer
Text: Leo 1 'the Thracian' is emporer of the eastern roman empire. First to be crowned by the patriarch. He is essentialy appointed by Aspar, the Alan commander of the army, who thought Leo would be an easy puppet to rule. However Leo is capable and has Aspar assissinated eventualy.

Headline: Leo 2 emporer
Text: Leo 2 made emporer as a child of 7. He is very sickly and soon dies, he is made co-ruler with Zeno, who has the actual power.

Headline: Zeno emporer
Text: After Leo 2 dies, possibly poisoned, possibly just died. Zeno is now the sole holder of power, as a commander from Isauria he is not popular.

Headline: Coup on Zeno
Text: Zeno is forced out of Constantinople after his mother in law told him about a coup. His mother in law then shortly takes power, along with other conspirators. Zeno flees to his homeland of Isauria.

Headline: Zeno retakes throne
Text: Zeno besieges Constantinople, senators open the gates for him and he is back on the throne. Conspirators of Basiliscus are killed.

Headline: Odoacer takes over Italy
Text: The barbarian Odoacer establishes his rule over the kingdom of italy.

Headline: Southern Qi Dynasty
Text: Southern dynasty

Headline: Henotikon established
Text: Zeno attempts to unite orthodox christians and Monophysites under an 'act of union'. This diplomatically establishes the two positions as legitimate, it is not effective.

Headline: Acacian schism
Text: The patriarch of Constantinople and the pope in rome excommunicate each other, causing a schism in the church. They diasgree on the Miaphytism.

Headline: Zeno pushes goths to italy
Text: Zeno steers the Goths towards Italy, getting their king Theoderic to take the ostrogoths to italy and invade Odoacer. This removes the germanic presence in the east.

Headline: Anastasius 1 emporer
Text: Zeno dies of dysentery. Zeno's widow choses and helps Anastasius into power, who is already 60 by the time of his ascension. Anastasius's rule is marked by sound financial policy, and leaving the government with a budget surplus. He returned to paying people in coin instead of in goods as this allowed for easier accoutning and less transport and embezzlement.

Headline: Theoderic kills Odoacer
Text: After beating Odoacer in several battles, a treaty is signed assuring that both would rule Italy. During the banquet to celebrate this, Theoderic takes out his sword and strikes Odoacer in the collarbone, killing him.

Headline: Clovis converts christianity
Text: Clovis 1, ruler over much of modern France, converts to Christianity.

Headline: Liang dynasty
Text: Southern dynasty

Headline: Sassanids invade east
Text: Sassanids invade Theodosiopolis and Amida, they are quickly driven back and a white peace is established. After this the fortress of Daras is established.

Headline: Monophysite enforced in Constantinople, riots
Text: Anastasius is friendly towards the Monophysites, and tries to install it in the liturgies of Constantinople. The people do not take kindly to this and riot, Anastasius is said to have put his life in their hands and calmed them down this way.

Headline: Justin 1 emporer
Text: After Anastasius dies at the age of 87, Justin 1 sneaks in to being emporer. Justin is the only one who commands troops in the city and distributes some gifts of money to make himself emporer. He adopts his cousin Justinian.

Headline: Justinian 1 emporer
Text: Before this, Justinian was already made Caesar, and is naturally made emporer after Justin 1 dies of old age.

Headline: Battle of Dara
Text: In the Iberian war, Kavadh invades the east. Belisarius musters his forces. He is outnumbered but gets to pick where the battle happens, using a series of ditches to shield his infantry from cavalry attacks, he uses his sueprior hunic horse archers to defeat the Sassanid empire. Some 25,000 byzantines fight 50,000 Sassanid forces.

Headline: Nika riots
Text: After an incident where deams were unsuccesfuly executed, and flee to a monestary. Justinians forces try to root the deams out from the monestary, however this causes the people to riot. Through several days of intense rioting, and senatorial backing the rioters try to appoint Hypatius, nephew of Anastasius. Justinian considered fleeing accross the sea but stays, his armed forces catch rioters in the Hippodrome, slaying some 30,000 civilians and Anastasius's nephews are executed.

Headline: Corpus Juris Civilis published
Text: Justinian set a commission to compile the roman laws into a single authorative document. The result is the 'body of civil law', it becomes widely referenced and spread as an authoritative source of law, and is at the basis of many modern law systems (such as those by Benjamin Franklin or by Napoleon).

Headline: Extreme cold
Text: A possible volcanic eruption in the tropics causes years of abnormally cold weather, mass famine ensues in the Northern hemisphere.

Headline: Hagia Sophia completed
Text: Built to be the most impressive church in the world, Justinian augers in this grand building. It is made too fast, and the roof collapses later. It takes around 10,000 workers some 5 years to complete.

Headline: Battle of Camlann
Text: Purported last battle of the legendary King Arthur.

Headline: Plague of Justinian
Text: One of the first outbreaks of the bubonic plague kills 25 to 50 million people, or at least 13% of the world population.

Headline: Weh Antiok Khusrau built
Text: Weh Antiok Khusrau, literally meaning "better than Antioch Khosrau built this", is built. This comes after Khosrau demolishes Antioch and ships its inhabitants to near Ctesiphon.

Headline: Buddhism introduced Japan
Text: Buddhism is first introduced into Japan from Baekje.

Headline: Sui dynasty
Text: Reunified north-south china

Headline: Tang dynasty
Text: Golden period in China, territory rivals Han dynasty. Largest city in the world is capital modern day Xi'an.

Headline: Battle of Karbala
Text: Husayn ibn Ali sacrifices himself to god along with some 110 others against a much larger army. One of the seminal events in Shia islam.

Headline: Umayyad Caliphate raids Visigoth Spain
Text: The visigoth kingdom has been weakened by civil war and so the Umayyad Caliphate sees a good opportunity.

Headline: Siege of Constantinople
Text: Arab muslims under the Umayyad Caliphate besiege Constantinople. Intitially they have won battles over Byzantine troops, and over the Byzantine navy. However, over the course of a year they have their supply ships burned by greek fire, have Bulgars attack them from Thrace. A resupply mission is killed by their christian crews. The Umayyads must retreat. This marks the first great defeat of the growing arab muslim unified empire, and they give up the conquest of Byzantine territories. Arab muslims have forces in the 120,000 men and 2,560 ships.

Headline: Battle of Tours
Text: Mercenary force of Frankish and Burgundian origin fights against the muslim Umayyad Caliphate, near Tours in central France. Stops Muslim expansion into central europe.

Headline: Charlemagne founds HRE
Text: The Holy Roman Empire (Not Holy, not Roman, not an Empire)

Headline: Great Heathen Army lands in England
Text: Combining vikings from Denmark, and some from Sweden and Norway. Vikings under command  of reportedly Hvitserk, Ivar the Boneless and either Ubba or Bjorn Ironside. They invade to conquer and settle in England. Establishing an area that would later be known as the danelaw.

Headline: Battle of Ashdown
Text: Alfred the great, then a prince under Aethelred, wins a victorious battle against the invading danes. The danes are a part of the great heathen army. Saxons are said to have around 1000 troops.

Headline: Five dynasties and ten kingdoms period
Text: An unruly and uncentralized period

Headline: Rollo rules Normandy
Text: The first viking ruler over Normandy, marks the norse starting to become normans.

Headline: Great Schism
Text: Roman and Orthodox church split over theological and political differences. Such as whether to use leavened or unleavened bread in the Eucharist.

Headline: Battle of Hastings
Text: Normans now rule England

Headline: Pope Urban recruitment drive
Text: Pope Urban holds a series of speeches accross france to arouse in people a want to crusade towards the holy land.

Headline: People's Crusade
Text: Led by Peter the Hermit, a 'army' or mob of 40'000 makes its way over with a destination of the holy land. They pillage lands in Byzantium, hold several fights. Eventually make it through an angry Byzantine Emporer Alexius. They make it to the borders of Byzantium and the turks but are vanquished in their first skirmish with the Turks.

Headline: Rhineland massacres jews
Text: Jewish Pogroms before the first crusade.

Headline: Crusade gathers constantinople
Text: The crusader armies under Hugh of Vermandois, Godfrey, Raymond and Bohemond gather outside constantinople with relatively few incidents. The crusader princes are summoned to Emporer Alexius to pledge to give former Byzantine territories back to Byzantium. Army numbers around 30-35,000.

Headline: Siege of Nicaea
Text: Garisson eventually surrenders to the Byzantine emporer. Local sultan Arslan is first occupied with a territorial dispute untill it's too late.

Headline: Battle of Dorylaeum
Text: Battle between the crusaders and the Suljuk Turks in Anatolia. It starts out with a large force of mounted turks against the vanguard of crusader forces led by Bohemond, untill later in the day when the main forces arrive. Crusaders manage to not chase the Turks and break their lines, instead standing fast and eventually manage to inflict even casualties on the Turks, leading to a decisive loss for the Turks (as their fighting number was smaller).

Headline: Siege of Antioch
Text: At first the crusaders feast, but as the siege drags on it is they who are starving outside the walls. Large numbers of crusaders start deserting.

Headline: Crusaders trapped in Antioch
Text: A large army of muslims arrive after the crusaders take Antioch, where they are now trapped inside and starving.

Headline: Battle of Antioch
Text: Bolstered by 'finding' the 'holy lance', which is to have pierced Jesus in his side as he hung on the cross. This find raises morale, the crusaders go out to fight the muslim forces and manage to win against a larger force. The muslim forces quickly break in battle because of political infighting.

Headline: Siege of Ma'arrat
Text: A number of crusaders split off to siege Ma'arrat al-Numan and capture it following a siege, much plundering takes place and canibalism is rumoured to have taken place.

Headline: Siege of Jerusalem
Text: Crusaders have difficulties getting wood to build siege engines.

Headline: Slaughter of Jerusalem
Text: Many muslims inside Jerusalem are ruthelessly slaughtered as well as jews.

Headline: Kindom of Jerusalem founded
Text: Godfrey becomes first king of Jerusalem.

Headline: Bohemont returns to Europe
Text: Bohemont returns to europe to start a recruitment drive for more crusaders to help, this time against Byzantium.

Headline: Bohemont subject to Byzantium
Text: Byzantine empire proves to strong, Bohemont becomes a vassal and is exiled from the holy lands.

Headline: Field of Blood
Text: Crusader armies of Antioch are annihilated by muslim ruler of Aleppo. Weakening but not destroying Antioch.

Headline: Edessa falls to Zengi
Text: The muslim ruler of Mosul and Aleppo conquers Edessa from the crusaders and puts the crusader states in a tough position.

Headline: 2nd crusade Bill
Text: The pope reissues a papall bull supporting a second crusade

Headline: Bernard rouses for crusade
Text: Bernard of Clairvaux, on behalf of the pope, goes around France and Germany and rouses people into wanting to join the second crusade, fashioning crosses out of cloth and even getting nobility to join in the crusade

Headline: Germans/French depart
Text: The germans and 1 month later the French depart to constantinople by land for the second crusade. The French are led by Louis, king of france, the germans by

Headline: Germans routed Dorylaeum
Text: After the germans make it through the Byzantine empire and refuse to wait for the French, they march through arid desert land all the while being assaulted by Turks. Not having enough supplies and harassed by horse archers they take many casualties at the second battle of Dorylaeum. They stumble back out of the desert with around 90% casualty rate.

Headline: French move to Lycus
Text: Taking the route close to the coast, the French have a safter passage than the Germans. However they do face one large loss at the battle of Mount Cadmus, where the vanguard gets seperated from the rest of the forces and the Turks sneak in inbetween.

Headline: Louis arrives in Antioch
Text: After the army has been defeated at Mount Cadmus and harassed around Lycus the French nobles set out on ships from Lycus, leaving most of the rest of the troops behind to go overland. The peasants on the overland route nearly all die, whilst the nobility faces storms at sea. Eleanor joins Louis to Antioch and meets with her uncle, Raymond of Poitiers.

Headline: Council of Acre
Text: Louis finally arrives in Jerusalem, and together with the regional christian rulers and the german king they meet to discuss what they want to do with the assembled forces, where to attack. The decision is strangely enough made to attack Damascus, the only friendly muslim state. By attacking Damascus, the only friendly muslims are alienated.

Headline: Failed siege of Damascus
Text: The crusaders assemble to siege Damascus, intending to feed on the orchards outside Damascus. However then they reposition to the side without Orchards, run out of water, hear of a force of muslims coming to attack them and decide to retreat. Whilst retreating they are harassed by muslim horse archers.

Headline: Genghis Khan born
Text: Temujin, one day the great khan and founder of the largest empire. He was born poor but a noble.

Headline: Genghis beats Ong Khan and Mamukha
Text: Genghis beats the two biggest remaining leaders of Mongol tribes, who had teamed up against him fearing his power.

Headline: Mongol Empire
Text: Genghis Khan devestates civilisations

Headline: Genghis sole ruler mongols
Text: Genghis Khan is proclaimed ruler of 'all who dwell in felt tents'.

Headline: Cambridge founded
Text: After 2 researchers got executed at Oxford University

Headline: Kuchlug takes over Khitai
Text: Kuchlug takes over the Khitai empire. Soon it will be over run by the Mongols.

Headline: Fifth Crusade
Text: Defeat of Crusader forces

Headline: Mongols sack Beijing
Text: Then called Zhongdu, the Mongols under Genghis besiege the city for 2 years. Upon capturing it the city is razed, a million people are killed for displaced.

Headline: Mongols take Bukhara
Text: Not slaughtering the entire city, the mongols take Bukhara after 15 days of siege.

Headline: Mongols take Samarkand
Text: A city of around 100,000. When the defenders charge out, the mongols feigned a retreat and slaughtered most of the defenders on open fields.

Headline: Jebe and Subutai raid east-east europe
Text: Jebe and Subutai lead a 20,000 strong mongol expedition and raid where they defeat the kingdom of Georgia, which was massing to join the 5th crusade. After they beat the Caucasus step tribes, defeat the Kievan Rus' and Cumans.

Headline: Battle of the Kalka River
Text: Jebe and Subutai defeat the combined Rus' army after a feigned retreat lasting several days which disorganises the advancing russians.

Headline: Annihilation Western Xia
Text: The Tanguts (or western Xia) had refused to help in Genghis' wars as they promised and they instead joined with the Jin to battle against the Mongols. This brought them no help and Genghis quickly captures many cities north of the yellow river.

Headline: Mongols sack Yinchuan
Text: The second most populous city in China and home of the western xia empire. Their emporer is executed and the city is destroyed. They finish the annihilation of western Xia.

Headline: Genghis Khan dies
Text: During the siege of Yinchuan, genghis dies of an unknown cause. He is taken back to Mongolia and buried in an unknown location.

Headline: Ogedei elected Khan
Text: After a kurultai, Ögedei is chosen to be the next khan.

Headline: Mongols loot Kaifeng
Text: After a siege of about 10 months, the mongols under Subutai loot Kaifeng. This was the capital of the Jin dynasty.

Headline: Mongols siege Caizhou
Text: The emporer of the Jin dynasty had fled here after the siege of Kaifeng. This was with the help from the southern song, who wanted to take Henan province.

Headline: Mongol invasion of Rus'
Text: The mongols under a force by Batu Khan conquer large parts of modern Russia, Ukraine and Belarus.After the death of Ogedei this area forms into the Golden Horde.

Headline: Battle of Legnica
Text: Mongols decisively defeat polish forces near Legnica, Silesia in the Kingdom of Poland.

Headline: Battle of Mohi
Text: Mongols decisively defeat between 80,000 and 25,000 hungarians, croatians and knights templar. With some Austrian forces. After this battle the kingdom of Hungary is heavily plundered, losing some 15-25% of its population.

Headline: Ogedei dies
Text: Ogedei dies, all Mongol forces are recalled for the kurultai, this time a successor is much less clear.

Headline: Guyuk made khan
Text: This coronation took a long time because Batu of the Golden horde did not want to come, fearing he would be killed.

Headline: Guyuk dies
Text: May have been poisoned but most likely died of natural causes.

Headline: Pope allows torture inquisition
Text: The Ad extirpands allows torture to be used in the process of uprooting heresy

Headline: Mongols invade Dali Kingdom
Text: The mongols with a force under Kublai invade the Dali kingdom in Yunnan province to prepare for their upcoming war against the southern song. They quickly win, and despite the Dali killing ambassadors are not massacred entirely. The area is completely pacified by 1256.

Headline: Mongols sacked Baghdad
Text: Marking the end of the Islamic golden age, the Mongols besiege Baghdad for 13 days. The city afterwards was largely depopulated, with the irrigation canals being destroyed. The rivers are said to have run black because of all the ink from books that were destroyed.

Headline: Mongke dies
Text: Possibly from dysentry or cholera during the siege of Diayu fortress in Chongqing.

Headline: Battle of Ain Jalut
Text: The mongols under Kitbuga with a force of 10-12,000 go up against the Mamluk Sultanate and are beaten.

Headline: Kublai conquest Southern Song
Text: Kublai Khan invades the southern song and afterwards proclaims the Yuan dynasty.

Headline: Yuan dynasty
Text: Successor to Mongol empire

Headline: Knights templar arrested
Text: The origin of friday the 13th, all Templar forces in France are seized and their property annexed by the king for money.

Headline: Mansa Musa pilgramige to Mecca
Text: A devout Muslim, the Mansa of Mali Empire goes on a pilgrimage to Mecca. He brings with him so much gold and gives it away on donations that the entire economy of Cairo, Medina and Mecca had no value for Gold in the next decade. He brought reportedly 60,000 men, each with 1.8kg of gold

Headline: Tenochtitlan founded
Text: The capital of the Aztec Empire is founded.

Headline: Hundred Years' War
Text: A war between rulers of England and France over the French throne. The war gives rise to England and French nationalism. In the end most holdings of England on the continent are given up.

Headline: Ming dynasty
Text: Mongols rule Mongolia (or north-north china)

Headline: Battle of Maritsa
Text: A small force of ottomans (800) makes a surprise attack on a much larger Serbian force. Through a night raid and fear thousands drown in the river Maritsa when they try to flee form the battle. 20-70k Serbians.

Headline: Timur marches on Moscow
Text: Timur took Elets and later advanced towards Moscow, but turned back before getting there.

Headline: Battle of Ankara
Text: Timur of the Timurid Empire defeats Sultan Bayezid I of the Ottomans. Timur captures Bayezid, who dies in captivity. Venetian and Genoese ships ferry Ottoman soldiers.

Headline: Timur dies
Text: Timur, the great conquerer of Perisa and many other places, dies. He was the first of the Timurid dynasty.

Headline: Jan Hus preaches Wycliffe
Text: Two texts from the reformer Wycliffe are brought to Prague and Jan Hus proudly reads the documents from his Pulpit. He had already served as the rector of the university of Prague before this.

Headline: Hus excommunicated
Text: Jan Hus is excommunicated through a bull from Alexander V.

Headline: Hus condemns indulgences
Text: Jan Hus condemns the indulgences and crusades of the church. He does not receive the support of the university in this but he does receive support from the common people.

Headline: Hus appeals to Jesus Christ
Text: Jan Hus appeals directly to Jesus Christ as the supreme judge, bypassing any laws and structure of the medieval church. A very significant event in the Bohemian reformation.

Headline: Council fo Constance
Text: Set out to resolve the western schism and the religious unrest in bohemia. Jan Hus attends and is soon arrested.

Headline: Execution Jan Hus
Text: Being found guilty for his theses, Jan Hus is bound to the stake and burned to death.

Headline: Hussite Wars
Text: The pope calls for 4 successive crusades against the Hussite community in Bohemia. None of these work and the Hussite faith is entrenched in Bohemia.

Headline: First Defenestration of Prague
Text: 7 members of the city council are killed by Czech Hussites.

Headline: Battle of Varna
Text: The final battle of the Crusade of Varna, attempting to root the ottomans out of europe. The battle involves many european powers including Poland, Hungary, Bohemia, Holy Roman Empire, Teutonic Knights. They are decisively defeated by the Ottomans.

Headline: Treaty of Tours
Text: A truce is signed between Henry VI of England and Charles VII of France in the undred years war. There was to be a marriage of a cousin of Charles to Henry, and the concession of Maine to France. Charles intended to use the peace to secure a military advantage, Henry tried to achieve a lasting peace.

Headline: Flower Wars
Text: To appease the gods, and mainly the war god Huitzilopochtli, the Aztecs and their allies stage a series of ritualized wars against their enemies Tlaxcala. This took place on preset dates in preset places, which became holy sites. These wars were to capture human sacrifices.

Headline: War of the Roses
Text: A english civil war between the houses of Lancaster and the house of York.

Headline: Sengoku Era
Text: The warring states period of Japanese history. A weak position of the emporer leads to lots of individual small states that war amongst each other and distrust each other.

Headline: Battle of Diu
Text: The ottoman empire and the republic of venice and the republic of ragusa join forces to defeat the Portuguese from establishing trade routes around Africa, which would destroy the profitable silk road. The ottomans lose and trade opens up for the Portuguese, Dutch and British so that Europeans start to colonise Asia.

Headline: Machiavelli published
Text: Machiavelli "publishes" The Prince

Headline: Spanish conquest Aztec
Text: The spanish conquest of the Aztec empire, done with the help of many warriors from Tiaxcala.

Headline: Cortés sails for Mexico
Text: Cortés has been appointed by the governer of Cuba to lead an expedition to Mexico. However when the governer of Cuba, Velazquez, suspected that Cortez might do more than explore and trade and instead conquer, he ordered Cortez to stop and appointed someone else. A brother of Cortez killed the messenger, and Cortez started his expedition in an act of open mutiny.

Headline: Cortés allies Tlaxcalans
Text: After 3 days of fighting and being surrounded by the Tlaxcalans. Cortés manages to build an alliance with the Tlaxcalans as they see Moctezuma as their mutual enemy.

Headline: Cortés burns down Cholula
Text: Together with his Tlaxcalan allies, Cortés burns down the second largest city in central mexico. Possibly to instill fear into Moctezuma and the Aztecs.

Headline: Cortés captures Moctezuma
Text: Cortés and his men were let into the Aztec capital of Tenochtitlan. This city lies on an island, connected by a few causeways to land. Moctezuma intends to cut off the spanish from retreat and crush them. Cortés manages to capture Moctezuma, and holds indirect rule over Tenochtitlan.

Headline: Cortés intercepts cuban expedition
Text: Velazquez sent an expedition commanded by Narvaez to stop Cortés. Cortés outmanouvers the expedition, beats them in a battle and then recruits them to join him, strengthening his numbers.

Headline: Massacre in the Great Temple of Tenochtitlan
Text: Cortes left a man behind to command in Tenochtitlan, Alvarado. He gets nervous about being in a city surrounded by hostile peoples, and to strike first kills aztec warriors and women and children during a religious festival. It is claimed a lot of people died, the Aztecs were unarmed.

Headline: La Noche Triste
Text: The sad night. Cortes has returned to Tenochtitlan, where the massacre has taken place. The Aztecs become less commandable by Moctezuma, gaining more hatred for the Spanish. In the end, the Spanish kill Moctezuma. Then the Spanish have to hurry out of Tenochtitlan under cover of darkness. With 1000 spanish and 20,000 native allies against 50,000 aztec warrior. The spanish make a retreat, but lose two-thirds of their Spanish brethern.

Headline: Smallpox arrives in Mexico
Text: An outbreak of disease brought by new spanish soldiers hits the Aztecs and Tlaxcalans. For 70 days smallpox rages in Tenochtitlan, and their new leader Emporer Cuitlahuac dies.

Headline: Siege of Tenochtitlan
Text: Cortes and primarily his Tlaxcalan allies, siege down Tenochtitlan. They first cut off the water supply and blockade the causeways. Then they slowly push further and further into the city through continous battle. After the end of the battle Tenochtitlan is further destroyed, and the foundations for Mexico city are laid. The city was said to be more beautiful than any in europe, with a population greater than all those in europe, save perhaps Naples.

Headline: Spanish conquest Tarascans
Text: Spanish conquest the northwest area of mexico/southern united states, the state of the Tarascans.

Headline: First siege of Vienna
Text: The ottomans are stopped at Vienna, stopping their tide of expansion into central europe. 17k HRE forces beat narrowly 120K ottoman forces. The ottomans had overextended supply lines.

Headline: Pizzaro captures Inca king
Text: At the Battle of Cajamarca, 180 spanish conquistadors kill 2000 personal attendants/lightly armed guards, take 5000 prisoner and capture Atahualpa, god king of the Inca's.

Headline: Münster Rebellion
Text: Protestant revolutionairies take over Munster and then get laid siege to, much suffering and torture ensues.

Headline: Nobunaga wins Okehazama
Text: Oda Nobunaga gathers 2-3k men for a surprise counterattack against a massive allied force of Imagawa Yoshimoto, helped by Matsudaira who were trying to march on Kyoto. Oda surprisingly wins this through a sudden attack whilst Yoshimoto's camp is sleeping. The surprise is total and the Nobunaga clan allies the Tokugawa clan.

Headline: Siege of Ishiyama Hongan-ji
Text: A siege of the main base of the Ikko-ikki, or warrior monks. Oda Nobunaga laid siege to it for 11 years, the longest siege in Japanese history, but finally managed to win and destroy the fort.

Headline: Nobunaga sets fire to mount Hiei
Text: Oda Nobunaga's forces attack the monastry of the Enryaku-ji warrior monks at Mount Hiei. The fortress was completely destroyed and the sight was one 'of unbearable horror' with a reported 20'000 people dying.

Headline: Inca empire conquered
Text: The spanish have completely conquered the Inca empire.

Headline: Sack of Antwerp
Text: Spanish mercenarys sack the city of Antwerp, at the time the cultural and economic capital of northern europe. This spurs antwerp to join the dutch revolt, and turns it from a protestant revolt into a dutch revolt. This also leads to people fleeing Antwerp and enlarging the city of amsterdam.

Headline: Japanese invade Korea
Text: A unified Japan under Toyotomi Hideyoshi invades the Korean peninsula. The Japanese win the land battles but are harassed at sea, and the Ming empire supports the Joseon koreans. After gorilla war the Japanese eventually pull back out of Korea.

Headline: Qing conquest of Ming
Text: Estimated death toll 25,000,000

Headline: Louis 14th rules France
Text: Sun King increases french power, centralizes it in monarch. Creates Versailles

Headline: Deluge
Text: Swedish occupation and ravishing of the Polish-Lithuanian commonwealth. The commonwealth loses 1/3rd of its population and its status as a great power.

Headline: Battle of Vienna
Text: Ottomans are routed by a coalition of the HRE, the Polish-Lithuanian commonwealth and some of Hungary after they lay siege to Vienna for 2 months.

Headline: Code Noir
Text: Law passed by Louis XIV, regulates the treatment of slaves by masters.

Headline: Principia published
Text: Newton's Mathematical Principles of Natural Philosophy are published, the foundation is laid for classical mechanics.

Headline: War of Spanish Succession
Text: The death of the last Habsburg king of spain, the infirm and inbred Charles II leads to a large war of the spanish succession. It is for the most part the Dutch, the holy roman empire, great britain vs France, Bavaria with Spanish on both sides. A total of 400k-700k dead.

Headline: South Sea Bubble collapses
Text: After having been supported by parliament and the king, trust in the eventual profitability of the South Sea company collapses. Englands economy is severely damaged. 70 million pounds had been granted directly by the king and parliament to help with 'economic expansion'.

Headline: First partition of Poland
Text: Part of poland divied up between Prussia/Austria/Russia to peacefully divide the weakened state of Poland.

Headline: War of Jenkin's Ear
Text: War between Great Britain and Spanish, brought about as a trade war. Not much changes due to the war, some 25,000 dead, mostly british, mostly naval.

Headline: Catherine maries Peter
Text: Catherine the great marries the heir to russia after becoming a member of the Russian Orthodox Church.

Headline: Small slave revolt Haiti
Text: Mackandal leads a black slave revolt, living up in the mountains and raiding sugar plantations, in the end he is captured by the French and burnt at the stake.

Headline: Seven Year's War
Text: Europe in conflict, britain victorious over France. Debt of britain must be handled by increasing taxes in US.

Headline: Rigid caste system Haiti
Text: A rigid cast system is defined on Saint-Domingue. Blacks and coloureds are seperated into groups based on how much white was in their ancestry. By the 1780's 60% of the coffee of europe came from Saint Doingue, and a 40% of the sugar. Lots of slaves imported to do the labour intensive work of farming this sugar. In 1750 there are 15k whites and 150k slaves, right before the haitian revolution this ballooned to 30k whites and coloureds and 300k slaves. At least 50% of all new slaves who came to Saint Domingue died from tropical diseases.

Headline: Peter emporer of Russia
Text: Catherine now empress together with Peter.

Headline: Catherine overthrows Peter
Text: After Peter almost attempts to invade denmark, Catherine steps in and overthrows him with the help of guards.

Headline: Stamp Act
Text: Widespread opposition in British Colonies

Headline: Virginia Resolves
Text: Revolutionary sentiment in Virginia, adopted by other colonies.

Headline: Declaratory Act
Text: Repealed Stamp Act, but declared UK still has sovereignty over colonies.

Headline: Townshend Acts
Text: Further taxing of the colonies, offer housing to troops, britain may enforce taxes on colonies.

Headline: Expulsion of the Jesuits Spain
Text: The expulsion of the Jesuits from the Spanish Empire caused much unrest in Spanish America, as many learned nobles had been educated by them and they had grown up in south america, leading to exile of many high placed friends. A lot of land is seized by the crown.

Headline: Catherine inocculated for smallpox
Text: The inocculation of Catherine the great and many nobles helps set up the large scale inocullation against smallpox of large parts of Russia in the following years.

Headline: Tea Act
Text: Free importation of east india company tea into american colonies

Headline: Battle of Bunker Hill
Text: British incur heavy losses on victory over Americans

Headline: Siege of Boston
Text: Endeding in the Fortification of Dorchester Heights with the Guns from fort Ticonderoga

Headline: Invasion of Quebec
Text: Amongst Benedict Arnold fail to invade Canada

Headline: New York Campaign
Text: British gain control of New York City

Headline: Battle of Brandywine
Text: William Howe flanks Washington over a ford, causes Washington to shattered retreats and give up Philadelphia

Headline: Battle of Germantown
Text: Washington attacks town north of Philadelphia, loses and retreats Washingtonlike

Headline: Battles of Saratoga
Text: Americans (Horatio Gates) decisively defeat british forces after british march exhaustingly and miscommunicate about backup.

Headline: France formally joins Americans
Text: France recognises the Americans as a sovereign country and goes to war with England.

Headline: British take Savannah, Georgia
Text: Part of a shift down to Southern colonies

Headline: Decree of Free Trade
Text: Decree by Charles III of Spain, Spanish American ports may now trade directly with one another and most ports in Spain instead of mercantilist policy of only single port in Spain. A larger military is also set up in Spanish America.

Headline: Spain war Britain
Text: Does not acknowledge seperate United States

Headline: Americans lose at Camden
Text: Battle of Camden, Charles Cornwallis routes the forces of Horatio Gates.

Headline: Battle of Guilford Court House
Text: Phyrric victory for the british as they drive back 4200 americans with 2100 british regulars

Headline: Washington March feint
Text: Washington marches troops 1090km, whilst not giving away he's marching on Yorktown.

Headline: Articles of Confederation
Text: Dragged on 2 years by Maryland

Headline: Treaty of Paris
Text: Fishing rights, restoration of property etc, acknowledgement of the United States

Headline: Washington prevents army coup
Text: Resigns commission in ceremony, pleads for men not to go down the path to army revolt.

Headline: Spanish close down Mississippi trade
Text: Americans no longer allowed to ship goods.

Headline: Shay's Rebellion
Text: Uprising against perceived economic injustice of the new government, way taxes worked.

Headline: Constitutional Convention
Text: Consitution drafted. No proportional representation, otherwise it would be the united states of virginia. The 3/5ths compromise is included here.

Headline: Prussia invades Netherlands
Text: France does nothing, revealing they are in deep debt. Prussia only demands reinstatement of Stadtholder in service of England.

Headline: Assembly of Notables
Text: Convened by Calone to be convinced to pass necessary reforms to stave of royal bankruptcy.

Headline: Brienne replaces Calone
Text: Calone tried to publicise his reforms to gain support, backfired, so king fired Calone. Tries to get greatest critic Brienne to push the reforms through.

Headline: Notables dissolved rejecting Brienne
Text: Assembly of Notables rejects reforms by Brienne (to solve bankruptcy). They are dismissed.

Headline: Parlament rejects edict reforms
Text: As it is a adjustment/new tax, it must be passed through the parlament.

Headline: King pushes through reforms
Text: To push through monetary reforms, the king calls a Lit de Justice, where the assembly is convened and sits there as the king declares new laws.

Headline: Estates General called
Text: Meeting with Estates General to address the debts of the crown.

Headline: May edicts
Text: Edicts by Brienne/King government to limit parlament power. Then be able to push through necessary reforms. Blacks are given citizenship when they are born of 2 free blacks.

Headline: Day of the Tiles
Text: Mob uprising after king tries to stop parlament of Grenoble to meet. Parlament is one of the last money sources for Grenoble, peasants riot. Happened on a market day so more peasants.

Headline: Requirements Estates General published
Text: Double the third, but no conclusion on voting by head or estate. Regular clergymen are allowed to be at the estates general, leading to lots of lower class clergymen instead of high priest officials. Nobles and clergyman allowed to go as third estate. There is much public debate over how the estates general should be constituted.

Headline: Constitution ratified, bill of rights added
"What is the third estate?" published
Text: Pamphlet stating "What is the Third Estate? Everything. What is it now? Nothing. What does it want to be? Something!" majorily influences sentiments

Headline: Estates general opened and quickly dissasembles
Text: On the second day, a conflict over whether the estates general should vote by head or by estate leads to the third (peasants, twice as big) refusing to meet with the others. Occupy main hall and subgroups meet to organize.

Headline: Death heir france
Text: 7 year old Louis Joseph Xavier Fancois dies, Louis 16th is devestated, as well as marrie antoinette.

Headline: Third estate meets on their own.
Text: After clergy and nobility refuse to join in, the third estate meets on its own. Nobility votes by large margin to not join 3rd. Clergy by small margin not to join.

Headline: 9 clergy join
Text: Several parish priests (lower level) join the third estate in their meetings, putting pressure on rest of the estate.

Headline: National Assembly proclaimed
Text: After much debating, third estate calls it's meetings the national asssembly.

Headline: Tennis Courth Oath
Text: After the meeting hall is closed by Louis 16th in an effort to restore order, he wants to preside over it later, the national assembly meets in the tennis court and swears that they will not seperate and whereever they are, there is the national assembly.

Headline: Assembly disregards Louis 16th
Text: Louis 16th calls royal seance, invalidates decisions by national assembly saying everything must go through them and orders them to leave. The national assembly goes 'or else?' and stays, Louis 16th lets them.

Headline: National assembly acknowledged
Text: Clergy and nobility have now joined them (part of nobility). Legitimized by the king. King orders more reliable military units to Paris.

Headline: Necker dismissed
Text: Necker was wildly popular at the time for trying to keep bread prices low, Parisians riot and burn unpopular customs barriers. Skirmishes with military, french city guards join crowd.

Headline: Great Fear
Text: Many peasants revolted in the country side, attacking manor houses and arming themselves in self defense. This happened after a bad harvest and rumours that nobles were intentionally hording grain to starve out peasants and drive up prices.

Headline: Abolition feudalism
Text: National assembly goes through all laws in 1 night and abolishes feudal rights and church levies/rights and much and more in a frenzy.

Headline: French Rights of man
Text: The national assembly adopts the Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen, drafted by Lafayette. Keeps an active/passive citizen divide.

Headline: Suspensive Veto granted
Text: Louis gets the power of suspensive veto, giving him the power to delay laws for 2 legislative sessions.

Headline: Royal guard tramples tricolor
Text: Rumours of the king's guards trampeling the tricolor of the revolution at a dinner hosted by the royal family spread throughout Paris, cause outrage.

Headline: Woman's march on Versailles
Text: Inflamed by Marat's newspaper, thousands of woman march on versailles to demand the king move to Paris. After hostile tensions and them not leaving, the king agrees.

Headline: Assembly meets Paris
Text: After the king moves to Paris the National Assembly moves as well. The conservatives sit right, the racials sit left, which is the root of our political spectrum. The move causes radicals to bunch together in the city center and grow more radical and organized, the conservatives house on the outskirts of the city to avoid lynching, they spread out and grow disorganized causing radicalization of the assembly.

Headline: Hereditary Nobility abolished
Text: National assembly abolishes hereditary nobility.

Headline: Oath of Allegiance for clergy
Text: French Clergy lose special status, require oath of allegiance to government first, not church.

Headline: Fête de la Fédération
Text: Feast of the federation is great unifying moment. Highpoint of Lafayette

Headline: Day of Daggers
Text: Lafayette orders arrest of 400 armed aristocrats who were protecting the king. Eventually forcibly removed from palace.

Headline: Mirabeau dies, put in Pantheon
Text: The first person to be put in the Pantheon, to be a hall for national heroes.

Headline: Flight to Varennes
Text: King attempts to escape France, gets caught by postal officer and forcibly escorted back to Paris.

Headline: Declaration of Pillnitz
Text: Prussians and Austrians vow to strenghten french monarchy, French public sees as overt alliance to invade France.

Headline: Consitution of 1791
Text: Constitiution accepted by the king. Seperates active and passive citizens.

Headline: Legislative Assembly forms
Text: Robespierre's motion of disinterest means no one from National Assembly is in the Legislative Assembly. No more old nobles in the assembly, just people who have lived with National Assembly measures for 2 years, causes further radicalization of the national government.

Headline: French ultimatum to Trier
Text: France disires war to unite disparate factions and root out traitors, thinks it will be easy. Threathen Triet to draw Austria in to war.

Headline: Slave uprising Saint Domingue
Text: The initial slave uprising, planned amidst a voodoo ceremony. A large scale uprising follows where slaves take control of the entire northern provine and the plains. They burn down many plantations

Headline: First Commission arrives Haiti
Text: The first three civil commissioners arrive in Haiti to restore order. By this point half the slaves in the north provine, 80,000 are in uprising, Toussaint Louverture holds a post as leader in this army. The whites have striken down a deal to free only ~60 slave leaders and return the rest to slavery because they do not want to negotiate with blacks, think they will win.

Headline: Austria Prussia alliance
Text: They formalize an alliance to invade france and defend the monarchy

Headline: Tuileries palace invaded
Text: Louis XVI veto'd laws about troup summoning and priest deportation, and angry mobs surround and invade his palace. Louis XVI makes symbols to show his sympathy.

Headline: France wars Austria
