Text: The national assembly declares war on the king of Bohemia and Hungary.

Headline: French retreat first sight enemy
Text: Near Lille the french soldiers retreat at the first sign of the austrian outposts and muder their general who they accuse of treason. This news spreads to paris.

Headline: Revolutionary Paris Commune
Text: In a revolutionary movement, Georges Danton executes a plot to overthrow the Paris city government, take over and are recognized by the national assembly. Now the de-facto government of Paris and major influence in france.

Headline: Storming Tuileries Palace
Text: National guard of Danton storm Tuleries Palace, slaughter Swiss mercenaries defending king and capture the King.

Headline: Lafayette into exile
Text: After a summons by the revolutionary commune, he fears execution and instead tries to flee to america, is captured and put in comfortable Prussian jail.

Headline: First guillotine execution
Text: A royalist Louis Collenot D'Angremont gets the dubious honour of being the first to be executed by the new humane method fo the guillotine.

Headline: Capitulation Verdun
Text: Verdun surrenders without a fight, many in France fear traitors in their midsts.

Headline: Massacre Paris Prisons
Text: Fearing troops marching on Paris, the parisians massacre possible defectors in the prisons.

Headline: French beat Brunswick at Valmy
Text: Causing a retreat of the Prussians by superior artillary and moral, the Prussians retreat back into prussian territory, choosing not to march on Paris directly.

Headline: National Convention elected
Text: Starting on september 20th, the National Convention holds it's first sessions. 113 of the 749 elected are Jacobins, sitting on the highest benches, they are called the Mountain. Because less than 25% of the people actually vote for the assembly, those who do not want to make contentious choices not voting, causing a very radical group.

Headline: Convention abolishes Royalty
Text: First French Republic proclaimed

Headline: Louis XVI trailed, executed
Text: Louis XVI appears twice before the convention, with some lawyers helping the second time. The convention quickly decides his guilt. They decide not to let french voters decide the king's vote and in a vote lasting twenty one hours there are 361 to 360 for immediate death penalty.

Headline: Second commission arrives Haiti
Text: The second civil commission arives in Haiti, comprising Sonthonax, Polverel and ... (alihaud). Come to enforce the law of april 4th which gives freedom and equality to all free people of color. Arrive with 2000 combat ready troups and given far reaching legal powers.

Headline: Second Partition of Poland
Text: Second Partition of Poland between Prussia and Russia, means that Prussia can now turn its full forces on France.

Headline: Dumouriez defects to Austria
Text: After calling against the anarchic revolutionaries in Paris, Dumouriez is called by the convention to come explain himself. Dumouriez tries to get his troops to march on Paris, but they don't and he runs away.

Headline: Committe of Public Safety established
Text: Danton and others join the commitee that is given widespread power over all of France. Becoming the de-facto head of government.

Headline: Siege of Maastricht fails
Text: French get as far as taking Maastricht in the Netherlands before they are routed and must run past Belgium back into France under larger Austro-Prussian army.

Headline: Marat acquited by Tribunal
Text: Arrested and brought before the Revolutionary Tribunal, the head of the Jacobins, he is acquited of all charges to the joy of many people.

Headline: Insurrection by Sans-culottes
Text: Sans-Culottes organized by the revolutionary commune, headed partly by Marat and Robespierre. They demand the convention disband, but the convention resists. Install government by Enrages.

Headline: Federalist revolt starts
Text: 60 departments from Marseille, Nimes, Toulouse and Bordeaux reject the new government.

Headline: Charlotte Corday assassinates Jean-Paul Marat
Text: Charlotte Corday is executed the next day. She hails from Vendee and is attempting to kill the leader of those opressing her region.

Headline: Levee en masse
Text: Levee en Masse voted in by the convention, every able-bodied non-married man between 18 and 25 required to serve in the army, will be expanded later.

Headline: Marseille recaptured
Text: Revolt in Marseille is crushed.

Headline: Comm. Public Safety power expanded
Text: Maximilien Robespierre elected to the committee, the committee is given more power and becomes the de facto dictators of France. The representatives on mission are withdrawn to Paris.

Headline: September 5th uprising
Text: Sans-culottes occupy the convention and demand that opponents of the revolution be arrested, leads to creation of new revolutionary army of 60,000.

Headline: General Maximum
Text: To counter the alleged (not really happening) price gouging of merchants, a maximum price is set on many goods. This causes a lot of merchants to be forced to sell at a loss.

Headline: Battle of Hondschoote
Text: Near Dunkirk, the french beat a british coalition army and rout them. The general Jean Nicolas-Houchard chose to regroup instead of charge after british, as with many generals before him he is declared a traitor and executed.

Headline: Lyon recaptured
Text: Uprising in Lyon put down by army of the convention.

Headline: Constitution put on hold
Text: Due to times of war, the new constitution is not enacted and put on permanent hold by the committee of public safety.

Headline: Cult of Reason
Text: Cathedral of the Notre Dame is reconstituted as a Temple of Reason, amongst violent dechristianisation the people will now pray to the goddess of reason.

Headline: Girondins executed
Text: Most girondin leaders have been captured and are found guilty and executed.

Headline: Reign of Terror
Text: Before this, between march-september 1793 66 people are guillotined, but now there is a time limit of 3 days on court cases, after which the accused are usually put to death. At it's height the guillotine is not enough and in Nantes there are 'republican baptisms' which tie people together on barges that are then sunk to drown them, and in other regions people are lined up before cannons and fired at.

Headline: Siege of Toulouse finished
Text: Napoleon Boneparte leads successful military operation that forces british to withdraw from Toulouse.

Headline: Sonthonax beats whites
Text: Sonthonax and the second commission beats a force of whites in order to enforce the law of april 4th. The whites are teaming up with the British to restore apartheid at this point. Many black slave forces are beaten.

Headline: Sonthonax beats Galbaud
Text: Le cap is attacked by sailors who had been lingering in the harbour after not being allowed to sail away, under the command of former governer Galbaud they attack the city. However fearing a large black attack they torch the city of Le Cap and 10,000 whites flee to the United States to seek refuge from the destruction.

Headline: Slaves haiti freed
Text: All slaves in Sant Domingue are freed by order of Sonthonax, abolishing slavery in the North. This is in order to calm down and soothe the black forces, strict labour codes keep conditions on plantations the same.

Headline: Trial Danton
Text: Danton and some others grouped in with him who had profited form corruption in the selling of the East India Company are arrested and put on trail. Danton is grouped with them to get rid of him by Robespierre. Danton uses the public part of the trail to mock and ridicule his accusers, as they have no evidence of his wrongdoing. Danton and the rest of those arrested are guillotined regardless.

Headline: Comm. general safety removed power
Text: A new bureau of police falling under the jurisdiction of the committee of public safety is established, removing the power of the second most powerful group in the country, the committee of general safety and moving that to Robespierre.

Headline: Law 22 Prarial
Text: The law of 22 Prarial means no more right to witnisses in court, no more right to counsel. Punishes the spreading of 'disagreement', trails now only end in acquital or death and are sped up. The begining of the 'great terror' the worst part of the terror in paris.

Headline: Infernal Columns
Text: 12 army columns are grouped and together march destructively through the Vendee, destroying everything they meet, killing all men, women and children in their path. This kill approximately 16-40'000 people.

Headline: Termidorian Reaction
Text: Robespierre is removed from power and killed. He insinuated that he was going to make lists and start prescribing who of the convention was to be killed, to get rid of conspirators that wanted to kill him. After hearing this, conspirators quickly conspired and rushed to oust Robespierre in the convention. He is ran out of the convention, shut up into the Hotel de Ville, no one joins them and they try and fail to commit suicide.

Headline: Kościuszko Polish uprising
Text: Attempting to fight against a final partitioning of poland, a general Kościuszko who fought in the american revolution leads the commonwealth in a last military fight against Russia and Prussia.

Headline: Treaty of the Hague
Text: Britain will fund a 62'000 army of Prussian soldiers.

Headline: Second commission recalled
Text: The French legislature recalls Polverel and Sonthonax. However in the French revolution much changes inbetween, and once Sonthonax comes home and is tried, he is acquited and his actions are recognised as good for all of france. The North provinces are de facto held by Toussaint Louverture, the south by Andre Rigaud. The British and Spanish hold many ports on the island.

Headline: Thid partition of Poland
Text: Prussia can turn it's eyes on France again.

Headline: Revolt 1 Prarial
Text: A populist revolt against the leaders of the Termidorian Convention, a large standoff occurs with some 20'000 protestors facing of against 40'000 defenders of the convention but no battle takes place.

Headline: France peace Prussia/Spain
Text: France makes peace with Prussia and a little later peace with Spain.

Headline: Failed Quiberon Bay expedition
Text: British attempt to lead emigres into the french coasts, but they fail miserably, the emigres are poorly coordinated get surrounded, surrender and 748 are executed by firing squad.

Headline: Consitution of year 3
Text: The constitution of year III is adopted by the convention. It restricts who can be elected and who can vote on those people. Duties now come along with rights, a 2 tiered house of government is introduced. No more government for the happiness of the people (scrapped from the bill of rights). The law of two thirds is added, meaning two-thirds of the voted in to the new assembly must come from the former convention. This is a big divergence from the idealogical origins of the French revolution.

Headline: Napoleon gives protestors artillery
Text: An armed royalist uprising takes place in paris against the convention. However, they try to make it past a chock point defended by artillery led by Napoleon Bonaparte and fail miserably after being shot at with 'a whiff of grapeshot'.

Headline: Gracchus Babeuf failed insurrection
Text: An insurrection, planned for several months by the proto-communist Babeuf fails after being infiltrated by agents of the police. Everything falls apart and all the leaders are sentenced to death.

Headline: Third Commission sent
Text: The third commission is sent including Sonthonax. They try to seize control from the colourds like Tousan and Santanax. They however bungle this attempt. Sonthonax and Toussaint work together untill Toussaint gets Sonthonax elected into the council of 500 and some time after shipped off to France.

Headline: Battle of Montenotte
Text: Napoleon victory over austrians.

Headline: Battle of Millesimo
Text: Napoleon victory over the Sardinians.

Headline: Siege of Mantua
Text: After many attempts to relieve the defenders at Mantua, Napoleon finally conquers the last city held by Austrians in Italy.

Headline: Napoleon encourages Cispadane Republic
Text: One of the first 'sister republics' or client states created by Napoleon.

Headline: Battle of Arcole
Text: Napoleon Bonaparte leads a bold maneuver against two austrian armies, first strikes at one of two armies coming into him at breakneck speed, fighting fiercly on equal numbers and then turning and smashing the other army which now had no retreat path. This narrowly avoids a strengthening of Mantua.

Headline: Toussaint orders governer freed
Text: Toussaint shows who really leads the northern provinces when he orders the governer Laveaux freed. Laveaux had tried to free blacks from prison which threathened Toussaints mulattoes.

Headline: Battle of Rivoli
Text: Final attempt to relieve Mantua fails after Napoleon reinforces an attacked army, winning at equal numbers.

Headline: Pretreaty of Leoben
Text: Napoleon negotiates the outlines of a peacedeal with Austria, far outside of his given command. However the final peace deal greatly resembles it and so Napoleon gets much of the credit. Austria surrenders Austrian Netherlands (Belgium) and Venice is divided between France and Austria secretly.

Headline: Partial french elections defeat
Text: 1/3rd of the timodorean convention is up for re-election, and only 11 of the 216 deputies are actually re-elected. Most are replaced by royalists.

Headline: Coup 18 Fructidor
Text: The 'coup from above', the timodoreans in power overturn the results of the election, arrest Pichegru and Barthelemy and forces royalists out of elected bodies.

Headline: Treaty of Campo Formio
Text: Peace between France and Austria along the lines of the pretreaty of Leoben. Only British at war with France.

Headline: Toussaint forces Sonthonax away
Text: Sonthonax is forced to go back to france by Toussaint to force on the council of 500.

Headline: Law of 22 Floreal
Text: Results of the election of april 18th overturned, leftist candidates are excluded. The timodorean government at this point does not really hold elections, and maintains power by breaking whichever other party si gaining power.

Headline: French fleet destroyed
Text: Napoleon left stranded with his army in Egypt against allying Turkish and Russian forces.

Headline: Cathrine the great dies
Text: Replaced by Peter who is far more anti-French.

Headline: War of the Second Coalition
Text: French against British, Austrians, Russians, Ottomans, Portugal and Naples.

Headline: Hedouville appointed governer Haiti
Text: Hedouville is appointed as the ruler of saint Domingue. This is an attempt by France to check the power of Toussaint, tries to play Rigaud against Toussaint. This does not work as Toussaint and Rigaud make a deal.

Headline: Toussaint makes peace British
Text: Toussaint accepts the surender of the British, over the head of the new governer Hedouville. The British have at this point lost four million pounds and 100,000 men dead or crippled from yellow fever and the war.

Headline: Toussaint captures Santo Domingo

Headline: Constitution Saint Domingue
Text: The new constitution by Toussaint declares himself governer general for life. France takes this as a great affront and Napoleon decides a force is to be sent over some time after.

Headline: Leclerc expedition lands
Text: After having British approval and waiting out for bad winds, a large force of French set out to restore Saint Domingue to the French sphere. Meanwhile Toussaint is preparing for a French invasion.

Headline: Le Cap burned down
Text: Henri Christophe, a general under Toussaint, burns down le cap rather than hand it over to the French forces. This excludes the diplomatic option for the French. The French invade the island, Toussaint pulls his forces back into the mountains. Many cities burn down.

Headline: Battle of Crete-A-Pierrot
Text: The Battle of Crête-à-Pierrot happens, with a phyric victory for the French as they take over a fort. Christoff eventually surrenders but the fight is a large morale boost to the native forces. Soon after this the French forces start to experience the 'avenging climate' where 50-60% of their troops die of yellow fever. This makes this the deadliest Napoleonic campaign for the generals.

Headline: Toussaint surrenders
Text: Toussaint surrenders and is arrested by Leclerc, he is shipped back to france where he dies in a prison.

Headline: Leclerc dies yellow fever
Text: The commander of the french forces is one of the last of the year to die of yellow fever. By this point most of his men have died of it and he is raving of how the island can only be held by total genocide of the black forces and how the expedition is a huge failure. Large scale uprisings due to threathened re-enslavement.

Headline: Napoleon reestablishes slavery
Text: Napoleon makes a proclemation that reestablishes slavery, this spreads to Saint Domingue in august where news also comes of harsh reenslavement in Guadeloupe.

Headline: Large scale insurrection
Text: The blacks rise up in the mountains and kill plantation managers. The French start to execute a large number of plantation leaders in for example mass drownings. Leclerc kills all black soldiers after an attack on le cap.

Headline: Military leaders defect
Text: After having come over to the French in peace talks, many of the black and coloured leaders of Saint Domingue defect back over, such as Dessalines and Christophe. A united revolutionary army forms around them.

Headline: Louisiana purchase
Text: France cedes its north american territory to the United States. This also marks Napoleons withdrawel from Saint Domingue, as the campaign has conclusively failed.

Headline: French surrender to Dessalines
Text: The french commander Rochambeau surrenders to Dessalines after losing the battle of vertieres. They promise to evacuate soon.

Headline: Grand Armee assembled
Text: Originally trained and drilled by Napoleon for an invasion of England, this turned to one of the most well trained armies in the history of the world.

Headline: Haitian declaration of independence
Text: Dessalines proclaims Haiti's independence from France, the name Saint-Domingue is abolished forever.

Headline: Genocide of the French
Text: Dessalines forces the rest of his officers, and together makes a genocide on the remaining white French. 4,000 French are killed.

Headline: Battle of Austerlitz
Text: 66'800 decisively defeat 85'400 Austrians/Russians and end the Holy Roman Empire. Some 17'000 die, 16'000 Austrian/Russians. Napoleon baits the coalition into attacking him. After penetrating a weak coalition center napoleon manages to flank the largest concentration of forces on the french right flank, breaking and routing the enemy.

Headline: Napoleon Enters Vienna
Text: Napoleon, after defeating HRE forces at Ulm, forces the russian forces under Kutuzov to retreat past Vienna, Napoleon enters and takes the Austrian capital.

Headline: Battle of Ulm
Text: Napoleon encircles an entire Austrian army, forcing their surrender. Of the 40,000 austrians under Karl Freiherr Mack, 27,000 are captured, 4,000 dead and 66 cannons captured.

Headline: Abdications of Bayonne
Text: Charles IV and his son Ferdinand VII are both forced to abdicate the throne of Spain by Napoleon, leading to a vacuum of power in the Spanish empire. Everyone still fights to return the rightfull king to power, but they all do it under their own banner.

Headline: Central Junta falls

Headline: Caracas Earthquake

Headline: Monteverde conquers Venezuela

Headline: Battle of Leipzig
Text: 225'000 French take up battle against 380'000 coalition forces. A total dead of 38'000 to 54'000 this is the first major defeat for Napoleon. This was the largest battle in Europe prior to World War 1.

Headline: Admirable Campaign
Text: Simon Bolivar holds a series of lightning quick raids and marching to uproot and free Venezuela from Spanish control. With Marino's simultanious campaign coming at Venezuela from the east, the two defeat the royalist Monteverde. This campaign makes Bolivar famous.

Headline: Decree War to the Death
Text: Bolivar proclaims his Decree of War to the Death, promising ot kill any Spaniard not actively supporting independence.

Text: Capturing an inland city, Bolivar now builds up forces from the inland and befriends the llanero cowboys, earns the nickname of Ironass.

Headline: Bolivar crosses Andes
Text: After crossing the Andes with his army Bolivard beats the royalists at Vargas Swamp Battle.

Headline: Battle of Boyacá
Text: Bolivar and Santander defeat royalist panish forces, obliterating victory for Bolivarian forces.

Headline: Battle of Carabobo
Text: Patriot forces under Bolivar defeat the Spanish royalists under Miguel de la Torre. Spanish are driven from Gran Colombia and Venezuela has its independance. Modernday Columbia, Ecuador, Panama and Venezuela were created, though most of the people in these lands don't want to be together but be independant, it is held together by the charisma and personal power of Bolivar.

Headline: Guayaquil conference
Text: Bolivar and San Martin, liberator of southern South America, hold conference to plan the indepence of Spanish South America.

Headline: Battle of Pichincha

Headline: Battle of Ayacucho
Text: In the Peruvian war of Independence, Sucre defeats the Spanish royalist forces at Ayacucho. This ends the Spanish rule in South America.

This is not taken well internally because it is essentially phrased as Haitians purchasing their freedom as slaves, though they have already paid for it in blood. The debt and the payments on the debt force Haiti into crippled economic conditions for the next hundred years, at some points up to 50/80% of the state budget go towards paying off the interest on the debt.

Text: Bolivar dies of tuberculosis in Santa Marta, Columbia.

Headline: First Opium War

The cause for the opium wars is that the East India company wants to trade directly with Chinese merchants and not through the corrupt Kanto system. Tea tariffs are 1/6th of the British Crown income at this time, the chinese do not want any British goods except for Opium.

Headline: Great Purge
Text: Happening from 1936 to 1938 with the most intensive period around 1937-1938. A large part of the Soviet generals and officers is purged by fears of Stalin. This weakens the army immensely and weakens it in the initial war against Germany.

Headline: Invasion of Poland
Text: Hitler invades Poland under a pretense. Poland is defeated by the 6th of october.

Headline: Winter War
Text: Russia invades Finland, but despite the Finnish having much less manpower, fewer tanks and such the Stalinist purges of the leadership cause more than expected casualties and make for a poor showing by the red army. This leads Hitler to detect weakness. The Finns still cede some of the prime industrial areas to the Soviets.

Headline: Operaton Barbarossa
Text: The largest 'surprise' attack in history. With Stalin trusting Hitler not to invade him, the German initially make huge advances and come close to Moscow. A total of 4 million Axis personell is involved, some 600,000 motor vehihcles, 700,000 transport horses. Germany included Romania, Finland, Italy, Hungary, Slovakia and Croatia as allies. On the Russian side are 2.6 million personnel, with 11,000 tanks, 7,133 aircraft vs the german 3350 tanks and 2770 planes, the soviets however have many older models. Total casualties for the year are over 1,000,000 for the Germans and 4,973,820 for the Soviets.

Headline: Minsk encirclement
Text: The belo russian front has 22,000 casualties per day during this period. It is one of many fronts. D-day had 19,000 total casualties. The germans encircle the russians around Minsk in the battle of Bialystok-Minsk

Headline: Smolensk encirclement
Text: In the Battle of Smolensk, 3 complete soviet armies are encircled and destroyed, around 400km west of Moscow. 186,144 soviets killed, total of 759,947 casualties.

Headline: Siege of Leningrad
Text: After a start early in 1941, this siege lasted most of the war. A total of 579,985 german casualties. The Soviets had 1,017,881 killed, captured or missing with a total of 3,436,066 casualties.

Headline: Battle of Moscow
Text: Many of the german officers have been killed at this point. Just under 2 million Germans assault 1,250,000 soviets, they are hindered by not having winter clothing.

Headline: -53 celcius Moscow
Text: German troops around Moscow are still in summer uniforms and are not prepared for the Russian winter, this winter being the coldest of the entire century. It is at this time that the Russian forces from the far east start arriving.

Headline: Barvenkovo mousetrap
Text: Soviets try to counterattack but are encircled, Stalin and officers underestimate 6th army's potential. Germans suffer 20,000 casualties compared to soviet massive 277,190.

Headline: Battle of Stalingrad
Text: The germans attempt to take Stalingrad but are dragged into fierce city fighting whilst soviet reinforcements show up. In the end the 6th army gets cut off and surrounded, the breaking points of the german army. 728,000 german casualties against 1,129,619 soviet casualties (478,741 killed or missing). Depending on definitions, the largest and bloodiest battle in history.

Headline: Operation Uranus
Text: Lasting for 4 days, the Soviets flank, pincer and surround the German 6th army. The soviets take advantage of the weak defences of the german supply train.

Headline: Airfields Stalingrad captured
Text: The soviets now hold all the airfields at stalingrad, the 6th army can get no more supplies.

Headline: Paulus captured
Text: Just made a field marshel, Friedrich Paulus is captured by the soviets but does not commit suicide.

Headline: Battle of Kursk
Text: Also called operation citadel, the Germans amass all their forces for one great battle against the soviets. The soviets knew months in advance and due to german delays had time to design and build defence in depth. At its height this sees 940,900 germans with 3253 tanks square off against 2,500,000 soviets with 7,360 tanks. Around 184,000 german casualties to 863,000 soviet casualties. However the Soviets have more men ready, and the Germans lose the initiative.

Headline: Korsun Pocket battle
Text: In the battle of the Korsun-Cherkassy Pocket, germans are encircled by Ukrainian forces under russian command, they do eventually manage to break out but lose many men. Some 85,000 germans are killed compared to 24,000 soviets. Germans lose much heavy weaponry.

Headline: Operation Bagration
Text: A large scale attack by the soviets in Byelorussia. This operation destroys the front line of the eastern germans. 300,000-550,000 german casualties,, with 770,888 soviet casualties.

Headline: Warsaw Uprising
Text: The poles rise up against the Germans in Warsaw, but are not helped by the Russians and are crushed violently by the Germans. Some 25,860 polish casualties, 25,000 german casualties.

Headline: Battle of Berlin
Text: 2,500,000 soviet soldiers are assembled against the remnants of the german army supplamented by the old men, the hitler youth and the police to around 766,750. The germans are destroyed.
